intro: Machaeranthera canescens var. ziegleri, commonly known as the Ziegler's tansy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, gray-green leaves with a fuzzy texture, and it produces yellow-orange ray flowers surrounded by pale yellow disk flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its botanical structure supports its role as a wildflower and potential ornamental plant.
